result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dean E Larsen was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Dean E Larsen was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

12 months county jail with work release.  Jail to begin immediately.  0 days credit.

Defendant to submit to, attend, pay for, and successfully complete AODA and any other educational or treatment programs ordered by the agent.

Court has ordered fine and court costs paid in full to the Clerk of Court within 60 days.  For this reason, fine and costs NOT to be collected by the agent.  If Defendant is unable to pay in full within 60 days, he may seek a payment plan arrangement with the Clerk of Court.  Payment plans not kept current may be subject to failure-to-pay actions by the Clerk including commitment order, tax refund interception, civil judgment, and turnover to a collection agency.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

miscConds.notes: Payable to the Clerk of Court; ordered paid within 60 days.
Payable also to the Clerk of Court.

supervisions.notes: Payable to the Clerk of Court within 60 days.

With huber and consecutive to the conditional jail time in Count 1.
Consecutive to: Count 1 conditional time

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dean E Larsen in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF94/plea/sentencing, 15TR1652-1654/status.  Atty. L informs Court the parties have agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to OWI 6th in count 1; count 2 will be dismissed; count 3 will be added via information to be filed with charge of obstructing and def will also plead to that count. Agreed-upon dispo calls for probation with conditional jail time of 1 yr on count 1 and 8 months jail, conseuctive on count 3.  Prelim rights waived with colloquy. Information filed. Charges stated; reading waived. Def pleads guilty to counts 1 and 3.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  
Count 1 - withheld for 3 years probation with conditions of 12 mo county jail with work release, $600 plus costs, 36 mo revocation, 36 mo IID upon relicensing, AODA and all other education/treatments as ordered by the agent.
Count 3 - 8 months jail, consecutive to sentence in Count 1 - this being a straight sentence, with huber.  
60 days to pay.  If unable to pay within 60 days, may seek payment plan with COC.
Jail to begin immediately.
DNA sample to be submitted.
Felony admonishments provided.
0 credit in the event of revocation.

Three TR cases dismissed.

Defendant Dean E Larsen in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading having been waived, Atty. L states that he will be filing motion to collaterally attack prior, uncounseled OWI convictions; also states def is waiving right to prelim.  Court conducts prelim waiver.  Prelim waived.  DA states State will be bringing forth same charges in the complaint to the information.  As such, Court states the charges.  Formal reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Motion hearing requested and set for Friday, 3/4 at 9.  Motion and affidavits to be filed by 3/1.  1 hour set for the motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  No bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of sale of alcohol.

Defendant Dean E Larsen in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA asks for 10k signature bond with no drink, no tavern, and test-on-demand.  No objection by the Defense.  Court so orders.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  Rights stated including right to prelim.  Prelim time limits waived.  Waiver accepted.  Status requested and set (set as AIA as reminder that prelim's not yet been held).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
